intro: Dianthera eustachiana, commonly known as the yellow sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain several seeds. Dianthera eustachiana is adapted to withstand drought conditions and plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils.
